chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Moten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: current sentence but concurrent with count 5 in 15CF1485

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Report to Racine Vocational Ministry. Participate in the Fatherhood Program at the YMCA. Under go a mental health assessment and follow through with the recommendations. Engage in a domestic violence program. No contact with R.L. (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

**CORRECTED 8/22/2019: To reflect 365 days of credit.  Defendant has 438 days of credit, remainder of credit will be applied in 15CF1485.**
Concurrent with: Count 3.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with R.L., J.L. or Ms. Pinkowski.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including abuser counseling and anger management counseling.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: current sentence but concurrent with count 2 & count 1 & 2 in 15CF1485.
